functions.description: Clone the project repository
Install necessary dependencies for the project
Initialize an instance of Excel reader to work with the 'Spring Semester Subjects.xlsx' file
Use the initialized Excel reader to read the data from the sheet and store it in a 2-dimensional table
Clean the table data as required, including converting 'Time' values into standard objects
Initialize an instance of Excel writer to write data into a new 'Results.xlsx'
Set the header for the new Excel file, using the existing sheet's headers as a reference
Use the initialized Excel writer to write the cleaned table data into the new 'Results.xlsx'
Collect 'Gamedata.xlsx' dataset containing columns for the dependence (result) and independence variables.
Preprocess the data to handle missing values, if any, and standardize the data
Implement the lag process on the dependence variable 'result'.
Fit a logistic regression model using all independence variables and the processed dependence variable.
Evaluate the performance of the logistic regression model based on appropriate metrics (e.g., accuracy, precision, recall).
Export the summary of the logistic regression model to 'Logistic.xlsx' for easy access and interpretation by users.
Ensure that the system has required software for scripting, data reading, and charting (e.g., Python, Pandas, Matplotlib).
Set up a new project directory, import required libraries, and load the 'Deathlist.csv' dataset into memory.
Clean the data by handling missing values (NA) appropriately and convert the date format of 'Date of death' column to a useful datatype for analysis (e.g., datetime).
Group the data using the appropriate datetime operations, ensuring to create week-level bins.
Using Matplotlib or another charting library, create and display a histogram showing the distribution of weekly deaths.
Test the script with a small subset of the dataset if needed, then refine as necessary to ensure it is working correctly
